item.title: bad philosophy
item.description: Some ideas are worse than others

item.title: The Beginning of Infinity
item.description: 2/26 - 496 pages https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beginning_of_Infinity Deutsch is so fucking smart. Lots of thinking about thinking - why a tradition of criticism is crucial to knowledge creation and why such a process is unbounded. An intuitive, non-mathematical explanation for the multiverse and quantum mechanics. A rich but fabricated dialogue between Socrates (assuming that Deutsch got a bit carried away with the personification) and Hermes. An inspirational call to dredge deep space for raw mass to build space stations.

item.title: Zero to One
item.description: 2/24 - 224 pages https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_to_One Very clear writing. Easy to digest the ideas too quickly without really thinking or appreciating significance. Monopolies being mutually exclusive from capitalism is one kicker. The actual importance of distribution/sales in an engineering-heavy context is another.

item.title: Genomic sequencing pipeline
item.description: Automated analytics and screening of sequencing data.

I’m a software engineer and synthetic biologist with a firm belief in building from first principles . I’m trying to develop systems and tools to engineer living systems from scratch. I studied Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, and Bioengineering at Berkeley. I dropped out to work on a stealth startup with pre-seed investment from Lucy Guo , the House , and Tyler Cowen . I also do contract machine learning work on synthetic proteins at Serotiny .

item.title: Research
item.description: Tijana Radivojević et al. ART: A machine learning Automated Recommendation Tool for synthetic biology Presentations A brief overview of Machine Learning and its application to Metabolic Engineering “Techniques for the purification of murine norovirus glycan binding domains” Advancing Wet and Dry Lab Tools to Accelerate the BioFoundry Design-Build Process “TOP-10cc: a streamlined cloning system with inducible copy-control” “Analysis of LOXL2 Mediated Regulation of the SPTBN1 Gene in Human Gingival Fibroblasts”
